dmca.title: Case ID 102610360 - Notice of Claimed Infringement
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.


-----Original Message-----
From: TallyCopyrightEnforcement [mailto:tspl.legal@tallysolutions.com]
Sent: Friday, December 02, 2005 2:37 AM
To: George Poletes
Subject: Case ID 102610360 - Notice of Claimed Infringement

?Friday, December 02, 2005


ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
1333 North Stemmons Freeway
Suite 110
Dallas, TX  75207  US

Piracy of copyrighted application  software Tally 7.2 Infringing IP:
70.84.169.90


Dear George Poletes:

We are writing this letter on behalf of Tally Solutions Pvt. Ltd. ("Tally").

You are providing and controlling internet services to customers through
internet accounts. One of the requirements for control of the accounts is to
ensure that the users do not indulge in unlawful and illegal activities.
Any acts of commission and/or omission in the accounts operated through your
services makes you responsible and accountable for the consequences.

Tally has invested substantial time and resources to create Tally 7.2, a
software application for financial accounting.   This software is in great
demand and the licensed version of the software is available for purchase in
the market.     

We find that the account holder using the above listed IP and operating
under your internet service is proliferating  piracy of  Tally 7.2
including its illegal distribution.  This is causing Tally substantial
revenue loss.  Below we have listed some details of the incidents of piracy
through internet accounts maintained with you during the past 6 weeks.   You
are thus not only causing Tally loss of substantial revenue but are also
indulging in acts of commission and omission warranting criminal and civil
action under the laws of India and other countries who are signatory to WTO
conventions.  

By this letter, we request that you let us know how you propose to
compensate us for the financial loss that you are causing by permitting
proliferation of millions of copies of pirated software of Tally 7.2 and the
action you are going to take to stop the permission of use of your services
as internet service providers to software pirates maintaining accounts with
you.

We are continuously monitoring the piracy of our software through your
internet site.  We call upon you to immediately cease the unlawful
activities of the users of your internet service and persuade them to
acquire the legal version of our products in lieu of all unauthorized
copies.

We trust you will take immediate steps to remedy the situation and inform us
about the actions you have taken and you propose to take to prevent
recurrence of the piracy.  We look forward to hearing from you.  In your
future correspondence with us, please refer to Case ID 102610360.

Respectfully,

Mark Weaver,
MediaSentry Director of Enforcement
